reviewText: The first episode of this second season, ETUDE IN BLACK, was broadcasted on Sept. 17th, 1972. It's also possible to watch this episode in the DVD standard by purchasing Columbo - The Complete Second Season. Director John Cassavetes, the villain of the episode, shot about one third of ETUDE IN BLACK; besides, he also worked with Peter Falk in his own directorial efforts Husbands,A Woman Under the Influence and Big Trouble. Hollywood legend Myrna The Thin Man (Keepcase) Loy and the adorable Blythe Danner complete this first-class cast. We learn one or two new things about Columbo in this episode: he's just adopted an unnamed old dog and he definitively loves classical music. A scene like the dialogue between Falk and Cassavetes about how much does the orchestra conductor earn per year is a little pearl and the performance of John Cassavetes, in front of his musicians, during the concert and during the rehearsals is praiseworthy. Season two can only be a winner with such an opener ! A VHS to keep in your library.

As always with Columbo episodes, this second season opener has great writing, great acting and much drama. This episode has a musical theme with excellent classical music. The airdate is September 12, 1972 with guest stars Nicholas Colasanto, Anjanette Comer, John Cassavetes, Myrna Loy and Blythe Danner.

This is the episode in which Columbo's dog has considerable airtime.
